definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: And then all this earthquake happened, I thought, is that Karma?-when you are not nice that bad things happen to you.
sentences.chinese: 然后地震发生了，我当时就想，这难道是因果报应？

sentences.english: For it is the day of the LORD's vengeance, and the year of recompences for the controversy of Zion.
sentences.chinese: 因耶和华有报仇之日，为锡安的争辩，有报应之年。

sentences.english: Let not nemesis catch me by the swift ships.
sentences.chinese: 不要让报应女神娜美西斯用快捷的船舰捉拿我。

sentences.english: Apply your ideas with patience for the reward they may deserve.
sentences.chinese: 运用您的主意和耐心归报他们应得的报应。

sentences.english: For ye shall be requited according to your works.
sentences.chinese: 因为神根据你们的行为报应你们。

sentences.english: Don"t burn any bridges as it is a small world 24."
sentences.chinese: 不要过河拆桥，世界很小，你会有报应的。

sentences.english: The Buddha has always warned us against karmic retribution.
sentences.chinese: 佛说因果报应丝毫不爽。

sentences.english: You're enjoying yourself now, but a day of reckoning will come.
sentences.chinese: 别看你现在逍遥，将来会遭报应的。

sentences.english: One of these days you'll get what you deserve for speaking so cruelly about people!
sentences.chinese: 你这么恶毒地说别人，总有一天会遭报应的。

sentences.english: They brought it down upon themselves by killing so many cattle.
sentences.chinese: 这是他们杀了那么多牛招来的报应。

sentences.english: But if you recompense Me, Swiftly, speedily , I will return your recompense upon your own head.
sentences.chinese: 若回报给我，我必使报应速速归到你们的头上。

sentences.english: Apparently, many people now believe in Karma.
sentences.chinese: 显然，有很多人相信因果报应。

sentences.english: The days of visitation are come, the days of recompence are come;
sentences.chinese: 以色列人必知道降罚的日子临近，报应的时候来到。

sentences.english: Evildoers are bound to be punished in the end.
sentences.chinese: 做坏事的人到头来总会遭报应的。

sentences.english: This is an example of karmic retribution and how inescapable it is.
sentences.chinese: 你们看因果报应何等不爽。

definition: evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
persisting in evil brings about self-destruction (idiom)
pinyin: duo1 xing2 bu4 yi4 bi4 zi4 bi4

definition: to reap what one has sown (idiom)/to stew in one's own juice
virtue has its reward, evil its retribution
pinyin: shan4 you3 shan4 bao4 , e4 you3 e4 bao4

definition: virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to have only oneself to blame (idiom)/to bring trouble through one's own actions
death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
